synopsis.text:
Various synopsis:

In a delightful collaboration with Studio Kajino, a sister studio to the renowned Studio Ghibli, a charming 3-minute animated film graced the screens as a prelude to the Cutie Honey Live-Action movie. Yoshiyuki Momose, the esteemed director of Ghiblies, took the helm as supervisor for this short masterpiece. On November 16th, 2004, the film found its place on the 'Ghibli ga Ippai Special Short Short' DVD, nestled among other Ghibli gems such as Sorairo no Tane, On Your Mark, Space Station No.9, Nandaro, and an assortment of commercials.

In this heartwarming tale, a young girl's dreams take flight as she leafs through the glossy pages of a fashion magazine. Inspired and determined, she sets her sights on the city of love, Paris. But to embark on this journey, she needs something extraordinary – a portable airport.

Our story unfolds as a beautiful young woman relaxes in her cozy chair, casually perusing a fashion magazine. With a newfound sense of adventure, she takes a leisurely stroll and stumbles upon a remarkable discovery. High in the sky, a unique airport appears – an airport that can go anywhere! Bustling with travelers, heartfelt goodbyes are exchanged, and new journeys begin. Among these eager voyagers is our young heroine, ready to embark on her Parisian dream!
synopsis.author: mistral.mistral-large-2402-v1:0
